intro: Cycloloma platyphyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf cycloloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in suitable environments. Cycloloma platyphyllum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
